thread.title: FiveThirtyEight projections: Boston Celtics expected to go 48-34
thread.title_full: FiveThirtyEight projections: Boston Celtics expected to go 48-34

author: Jay King | mjking@masslive.com
title: FiveThirtyEight projections: Boston Celtics expected to go 48-34
text:
Comments 
Though Evan Turner is setting his sights higher than fifth place , the Boston Celtics could finish right around that spot, according to projections from ESPN affiliate FiveThirtyEight. 
The website used a regression model called CARMELO to predict how many wins the Celtics should earn this season. Based on the calculations, the team is expected to go 48-34 -- a record that would have resulted in the Eastern Conference's fifth seed last season. 
That would represent an eight-game improvement from Boston, which, like the math says, isn't out of the question. Before getting outclassed by Cleveland in the playoffs, the Celtics finished the regular season on a 24-12 rush, which would translate to about 55 wins over a full campaign. That doesn't feel like a probable mark, but Boston picked up a pair of veteran frontcourt upgrades and will now feature Isaiah Thomas all season. Even if the Eastern Conference should be improved, there's plenty of reason to hope the Celtics can take another step forward during head coach Brad Stevens' third year. 
CARMELO also provided some interesting player comparisons, such as Marcus Smart to James Harden (whoa) and Jonas Jerebko to Scott Padgett (not so whoa). Discover more with Chris Forsberg's writeup at FiveThirtyEight .
